TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed UnicodeEncodingConformance extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Controls how Unicode characters are output by the <xref:System.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode%2A> methods.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information on how Unicode characters are supposed to be encoded in HTML, see [Using character escapes in markup and CSS](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=256607).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Configuration.UnicodeEncodingConformance Auto = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Use automatic behavior. The Unicode encoding behavior is determined by current application's target Framework. For [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] and later, the Unicode encoding behavior is strict.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Configuration.UnicodeEncodingConformance Compat = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Use compatible behavior. Specifies that individual UTF-16 surrogate code points are output as-is when one of <xref:System.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode%2A> methods is called. For example, given a string "\uD84C\uDFB4" (or "\U000233B4"), the output of <xref:System.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode%2A> is "\uD84C\uDFB4" (the input is not encoded).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Configuration.UnicodeEncodingConformance Strict = int32(1)

Docs.summary:
Use strict behavior. Specifies that individual UTF-16 surrogate code points are combined into a single code point when one of the <xref:System.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode%2A> methods is called. For example, given the input string "\uD84C\uDFB4" (or "\U000233B4"), the output of the <xref:System.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode%2A> methods is "𣎴".
If the input is a malformed UTF-16 string (it contains unpaired surrogates, for example), the bad code points will be replaced with U+FFFD (Unicode replacement char) before being HTML-encoded.
